@Module.Name: Select
@Module.Description: This module is a selection model, selecting the 5 possible component without relativity ranking to be acted on catering to user's intent
@Module.Note: This individual module only select 5 highly related components,without ranking them,and without analyzing the correctness of the components aligning with user's content

Output.<div id=1 class='com.google.android.gm:i: This component indicates the 'Notes' sidebar tab which could help the user navigate through the Gmail UI.
Output.<div id=4 class='com.google.android.gm:i: This component specifically has the description 'All mail', which aligns with the user's intent to view 'all mails in Gmail'.
Output.<div id=16 class='com.google.android.gm:: This 'Compose' button doesn't directly correspond to the user's intent but it's a vital component of user interaction within Gmail.
Output.<div id=17 class='com.google.android.gm:: This component seems to be a search function within Gmail. Even if the user's current intention is to view all mails, having access to the search function could be vital for sifting through these mails.
This component represents the user's account details, while not directly related to viewing emails, this still forms a significant part of interacting with the Gmail UI.

@Module.Name: Plan
@Module.Description: This module is a plan module, planning the next action based on the selected components, whether click or edit

candidate1.reason: Switching to the 'Notes' label is not relevant to accessing all mails.

candidate2.reason: To access all mails in Gmail.

candidate3.reason: To compose a new email, not relevant to accessing all mails.

candidate4.reason: To open the search functionality, not relevant to accessing all mails.

candidate5.reason: Switching to the account settings is not relevant to accessing all mails.

@Module.Name: Evaluate
@Module.Description: This module is an evaluation module, evaluating the selected components of their contribution to fulfilling the user's intent

@Module.Name: Decide
@Module.Description: This module is a decision module, deciding the final action based on the evaluation result, whether complete or wrong or go on
